summary:
As a Project Manager with a focus on seakeeping, manoeuvring, and onboard comfort, I have extensive experience in the yacht market. My expertise includes roll stabilization, multi-body interaction in waves, launch and recovery, beaching tests, and RAS operation. 

As a professional with a diverse skill set, I excel not only in my career but also in various passions. I am a talented human portrait sketch artist who takes commissioned orders now and then. In addition, I, along with my team, are open to taking requests to conduct one-to-one sessions in personal finance and macroeconomics. Outside of my professional pursuits, I am a passionate investor who has achieved impressive returns through disciplined research and analysis with a holistic approach. When I'm not working, you can find me playing badminton, cooking and reading books, sharpening my strategic and analytical skills.

If you would like to connect, discuss any potential projects or for any quotation enquiries don't hesitate to reach out to me at: ùë∑.ùë±.ùë©ùíÇùíèùíàùíÜùíìùíÇ@ùíéùíÇùíìùíäùíè.ùíèùíç.

"Like a ship navigating through life's unpredictable waters, it is stability, not speed, that will keep us steady and on course towards our destination."

Supervisor: Professor Jonas W. Ringsberg

- Planning and conceptualization of a tool for the risk analysis of collision-damaged ship structures.
- Building a methodology to map metocean statistics and conditions on the seakeeping analysis.
- Developing damage stability risk evaluation technique using the motion responses.
- Developing a methodology that quantifies the ultimate strength risks for any vessel.
- Designing the layout of the risk tool in a graphical user interface.
- Simulations of the oil drift from the damaged tanker vessel and an economic valuation model for the oil pollution response.
